alert.note: Alert for Greenwood; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 21 at 4:23AM EDT until June 24 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Saluda River At Chappells affecting Newberry, Greenwood and Saluda Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Saluda River At Chappells. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Lowlands around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. Cattle grazing river bottomland should be moved to higher ground. At 16.0 feet, Extensive farmland and river bottomland around and downstream from Chappells become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM EDT Wednesday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 16.9 feet early Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov &&
info.instruction: Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don`t drown. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 1100 AM EDT.
